info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued June 06 at 4:17PM MDT by NWS Pueblo
info.description: ...A strong thunderstorm will impact portions of west central Otero and southeastern Pueblo Counties through 500 PM MDT... At 417 PM MDT, Doppler radar was tracking a strong thunderstorm 16 miles southwest of Fowler, or 32 miles southeast of Pueblo, moving east at 25 mph. HAZARD...Wind gusts up to 50 mph and penny size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor damage to outdoor objects is possible. This storm will remain over mainly rural areas of west central Otero and southeastern Pueblo Counties. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.75 IN MAX WIND GUST...50 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. A Severe Thunderstorm Watch remains in effect until 1000 PM MDT for southeastern Colorado.
